All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Application
Application is the main engine responsible for the main loop and its termination.
ApplicationGUI
ApplicationGUI is the application version that provides a Graphical User Interface (GUI).
ApplicationHeadless
ApplicationHeadless is the application version that does not provide a Graphical User Interface (GUI).
ApplicationSpecification
The class that holds the application settings to use during its creation.
Area
Encapsulates all the properties of an area
Button
To render a button
Category
Represents a category type with its explanation
Center
Represents all the properties of a monitoring center
Command
The Command class processes a command line string to extract and store a command and its arguments, provides methods to retrieve these values
ConnectionLostException
Needs to be thrown when an IOException gets thrown by a networking function
Console
Console is used to log messages or to request input from the user through the terminal.
Database
The database interface is responsible for communication between the application and the database.
DatabaseMT
The database multithreaded interface has the same responsibilities as the non-threaded interface (Database).
DatabaseRequestException
Needs to be throw when a database query fails
Dropdown
To render a drop-down menu
Email
The Email class creates and sends an email through the use of a SMTP server
InputText
The InputText class renders to screen a box to input text and holds the written string.
InputTextButton
Same as InputText, but with a button on the right (useful to implement a show/hide password)
InputTextMultiline
Same as InputText, but on multiple lines
Layer
The layer class is used to create the actual application.
Modal
To render a modal
Operator
Encapsulates all the properties of an operator
Panel
To group widgets together in another child window
Parameter
Encapsulates all the properties of a parameter
Popup
To render a pop-up
RequestType
This class contains enumeration constants that are used to send a request from the proxy (client) to the skeleton (server).
Result<T>
The result class is used to keep track of the data to be returned by a function that is being executed on a different thread.
ResultBox
The result box class renders to screen a list box containing a specified String array
Table
To render a table
Text
To render some plain text
Texture
Used to create an OpenGL texture ID
Tooltip
To render a tooltip
View
The View class manages the state of a view and handles rendering operations based on the configuration (headless or GUI)
ViewState
Abstract class that is used to represent all the view state of an application
Widget
To group all the common properties of a widget
Window
The class that creates the window through the use of the GLFW library and OpenGL
WindowSpecification
The class that holds the window settings to use during its creation
